name: Charlton Athletic FC History Quiz | Charlton Athletic | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what year were the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1905.

	Charlton have had numerous home grounds in their history, but most notorious is The Valley, in which they had three spells.

questions.text: Who was the club's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
Bill Rayner.

	Rayner managed the club for five years between 1920-25, followed by McFarlane (1925-27), Lindon for four months in 1927, before McFarlane stepped into the hot seat again until 1932, when Seed became manager for 23 years until 1956.

questions.text: Which club did Charlton sign Dean Kiely from in 1999?
questions.explanation:
Bury.

	Kiely has been at all these clubs, starting his career at Coventry between 1987-90. He went on-loan to Ipswich for one month, before moving to York between 1990-96. He was signed by Bury, and played there until a move to Charlton in 1999.

questions.text: In what season were Charlton first elected into the Football League?
questions.explanation:
1921-22.

	Charlton finished 16th out of 22 teams in the 1921-22 Division Three (South) season with 37 points from 42 games.

questions.text: Who did Charlton beat in the 1947 FA Cup final?
questions.explanation:
Burnley.

	Charlton won the game 1-0. They reached the final the year before, but were beaten 4-1 by Derby County.

questions.text: Which of these scored the more goals in a season for the club?
questions.explanation:
Ralph Allen.

	Allen scored 32 goals during the 1934-35 Division Three (South) season.

questions.text: How many games did Lee Bowyer play for Charlton before being sold in 1996?
questions.explanation:
46.

	Bowyer played for Charlton between 1994-96 as a trainee before moving onto Leeds United for a substantial fee. He left the Elland Road club in 2003 for West Ham.

questions.text: When Charlton became champions of Division One in season 1999-2000, which other team grabbed an automatic promotion place?
questions.explanation:
Manchester City.

	Charlton won the title with 91 points, 2 ahead of Manchester City in second place.

questions.text: How many appearances did Sam Bartram make for the club in his career?
questions.explanation:
583.

	Bartram set the club record for most appearances between 1934-56.

The Addicks.

	The club have been known as all of these and more, but adopted 'The Addicks' as their official nickname after a fish and chip shop in the area of their ground.
